texts.speaker: Véronique Laury-Deroubaix
texts.profession: Group Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Kingfisher Plc
texts.text: But the overall organization has learned a lot. And I think that was a really necessary as a first year of the [ph]  plan. (17:40) So, where we are on unified range? I think this is something you are waiting for and as you know,  I'm passionate about it, because I think it's so important in terms of the delivery of our plans. We said we would  deliver 4% and we have delivered 4% COGS. To deliver 4% COGS, we had to work on 8% of [ph] branches.  (18:05) This is why you have this exit rate of 8%.

texts.speaker: Véronique Laury-Deroubaix
texts.profession: Group Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Kingfisher Plc
texts.text: So, you will have different components. You have aluminium. You have wood. You have composite. You have  glass. You have those kind of decorative panel and you can assemble all of that. One of the things we learn from  our deep customer insight [indiscernible] (27:57) most people who have a garden, they don't have any way to go  on the site. When they have to do things in your garden, they have to go through the house.

texts.speaker: Véronique Laury-Deroubaix
texts.profession: Group Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Kingfisher Plc
texts.text: And when you are doing fencing, I promise you that going through your house with those big fencing is not easy.  This one is completely disassemblable and you can put it in your car and easily go through your home with those  products. So, this is a kind of things that we do. This is how we are going to bring some new stuff to people in  every of our market.

texts.speaker: Véronique Laury-Deroubaix
texts.profession: Group Chief Executive Officer & Executive Director, Kingfisher Plc
texts.text: So, this is our full list, if I may say. This is not the milestone. We'll see later on the milestone that you want us to  judge on and that would be [ph] burnishable (36:11) internally. But this is the full list of what we have to do this  year. We have to deliver 20% COGS. We are well set up for it, and we have to prepare for year three, because  year three is another very big year with very big category coming in. And if we want to deliver it properly, we have  to start this year.

texts.speaker: Steve Willett
texts.profession: Chief Digital & Information Technology Officer, Kingfisher Plc
texts.text: One of the other key learnings in there is really on managing the end-to-end process of remerchandising, from the  displays in the store to actually the physical change that we're putting through the shelf. And I'll talk a bit more  about that in a minute.

texts.speaker: Steve Willett
texts.profession: Chief Digital & Information Technology Officer, Kingfisher Plc
texts.text: And then, lastly, what we had to take account of as well is there's some spikes in things which occur in the head  offices. So for an example, if you're changing 25% of linear, you've got to change an enormous amount of point of  sale. So these other things and other issues that we've had to resource to be able to manage, to be able to  change that linear footage.

texts.speaker: Dorota Włoch
texts.profession: Executive Vice President, Business Development, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Good morning, ladies and gentlemen. I would like to tell you about the most important achievements of the first  quarter of 2013. The most important is the projection of the Sierra Gorda project. After verifying the budget and  the schedule, the project is on budget and on schedule. And the advancement or the progress of this project is  41%. So, most of – a lot of the constructions works and purchase works are completed. The construction of the  plant is completed by 25%. We've constructed a seawater pipeline to the mine. This was a little late due to issues  with permits. And that's it about the Sierra Gorda project.

texts.speaker: Dorota Włoch
texts.profession: Executive Vice President, Business Development, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: The third group of projects is our activities in metallurgy where we are renovating the plant. After four years, we  are planning a very large renovation, which is the first four year renovation cycle. And we hope to move on to a  five-year renovation cycle after this. And the renovation will last until the end of October.

texts.speaker: Dorota Włoch
texts.profession: Executive Vice President, Business Development, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: The next project is gaining new concessions for deposits that are currently being mined. We have an  environmental decision, which was approved. We are waiting for concessions which we should acquire at the end  of the first half of this year. And this is a condition for the safe functioning of our company. We started freezing of  rock mass required to beginning the sinking of GG-1 input ventilation shaft which has also been started.

texts.speaker: Herbert Wirth
texts.profession: President & CEO-Management Board, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: In the next part, I would like to tell you about production. And looking at this slide, we can see clearly that the  production of copper has grown 8%. And 83% of this was achieved by Polska Miedź. We've achieved the first place  of the largest producer of silver.

texts.speaker: Herbert Wirth
texts.profession: President & CEO-Management Board, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: In terms of precious metals, the biggest contributors are the Morrison mine and another one which are bringing  more and more value. Nickel production has slightly fallen. This was – we have a little less nickel than we  expected. The reason for growing costs at KGHM which is more than 44% which is due to the mining tax, which  translates into the results of the cost in the capital group. And capital costs at KGHM International have been  decreased significantly.

texts.speaker: Herbert Wirth
texts.profession: President & CEO-Management Board, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: In the next graph, you can see our production plan. And the results are equal to or a little over projected results. In  the summer time, we are preparing for a very large renovation project which will last more than two months.  Production in KGHM International, we've had a growing production of 18%. Nickel production has slightly  decreased and precious metal production has decreased by 27%.

texts.speaker: Unverified Participant
texts.text: In relation to the previous year, the copper price and the exchange rate were not very favorable for the company.  Much more favorable were the sales volumes. We've sold 44,000 tonnes of copper. A lot of it was from last year's  reserves. We would like to inform you that the coming quarters will not be so favorable due to the renovation at  one of our plants. Our revenue reached in the first quarter – was in a level of PLN5.1 billion, which was only a little  lower than in the previous year.

texts.speaker: Unverified Participant
texts.text: The increase in expense, by nature, by 23% was mainly due to introduction of the minerals extraction tax. As you  can see in the graph, the total unit cost is very insignificant. The cost of copper production has decreased by 2%.  And we've achieved 106,000 tonnes which is more than last year. However, due to the minerals extraction tax, we  have a cost – an additional cost of PLN4,500 per tonne.

file: KGH - Q1 2015 Earnings Call 11May2015 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 11-May-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Herbert Wirth
texts.profession: President-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: With respect to projects, apart from the strategy, another major project is Sierra Gorda. It's in a ramp-up stage,  and we've achieved 80% of the production capacity recently and we are at a plateau at the moment and reaching  for 100% capacity will take slightly longer, but we are planning this, both in terms of copper and molybdenum  production, and this is going to happen at the second half of 2015.

texts.speaker: Herbert Wirth
texts.profession: President-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: Now over to Victoria Project, we are still at the stage of building the Integrated Development Study starting with  resource base and with the technical blueprints for accessing the deposit. I will not give you the diameters of the  shaft. But we are about to receive all the pertinent permits. Now Deep Głogów, our project today, we are at more  than 400 meters, 489 meters down and we're still sinking, sinking in the frozen zone. It's a very important project  for us because it will allow us to continue mining the deep deposits, which require fresh air and adequate  temperatures.

texts.speaker: Herbert Wirth
texts.profession: President-Management Board & CEO
texts.text: In Q1, we produced 164,000 tonnes of copper, and we generated at a net profit of PLN 0.4 billion. With respect to  details, I will asked Mr. Koński to share with you further information.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, let me start with Sierra Gorda. We need to cover three issues, how we approach the full  capacity for copper and molybdenum; second is the second phase of Sierra Gorda; and three, oxides processing  project. In the first quarter of 2015, the average daily processing was at 66%. This curve is upward and the daily  processing in April grew to 80%, and as Mr. Wirth already said, in the second half of 2015, we expect to reach  100%. We're actually hoping for more because on individual days, we tend to increase the nominal value of  110,000 tonnes of ore processing per day.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: We have more challenges with molybdenum. The ultimate molybdenum content in the concentrate is at 47%.  Currently, we are at around 40% – nearly 40%. However, we would like to tell you that the curve is rising.  However, the transition before we go to the ultimate molybdenum content and the concentrate to make it fully  valuable is taking slightly longer. However, this is the sort of level which is already acceptable by the processor of  molybdenum. So the first shipment of molybdenum has already been completed.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: With respect to Phase II of the project, we are working with two technical advisors on optimizing the processes,  which have been enabled in Phase I of the project in order to learn from Phase I. As we expand the ore  enhancement or enrichment plant, we're going to continue optimizing for the next three months, and then we'll  start the basic engineering phase for Phase II of the project. And let me tell you that the target level of production  will exceed 200,000 tonnes of copper per annum.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: With respect to the processing of oxides, we have completed the feasibility study. And with [ph] SNC-Lavalin  (09:07), we've nearly finished the report which adds the capacity to produce copper by 30%, and the mining cost  do not occur here, 30,000 tonnes, because the material has been already stripped with overburden and we see  very high GRR (sic) [GRI] (09:36) indicators.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Now moving forward, the Victoria Project and Ajax Project. For Victoria, we are currently working on the  preparatory Phase IV shaft sinking. We've also validated the resources of the mine and it shows the level of 15  tonnes of copper and nickel and around 150,000 ounces of precious metals, palladium, platinum and [ph] gold  that (10:15) will be kept. So the plan is going to be met and the cash cost will be lower than revenue. And we've  also engaged our Polish companies to design and supervise the shaft sinking process. The design work is done by  KGHM CUPRUM and the sinking is going to be managed by PeBeKa company.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: For Afton-Ajax project, as we announced earlier, we changed the configuration of the infrastructure for this  project. We are well advanced. We have already achieved 20% of technical blueprint. We are supported by a  company called Fluor. Three milestones for this year. We're going to file the application for the environmental  permit. We're going to file the mining permit application and we're going to complete the basic engineering  process. All this is scheduled for the second half of 2015.

texts.speaker: Maciej Koński
texts.profession: General Director-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Center, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Deep Głogów, the CapEx status is at 50%. So we've invested 50% of the total capital expenditures. Last year, we  started producing from this area and with this project, we're going to be able to maintain our production at more  than 130,000 tonnes and we're going to mine using the Polkowice-Sieroszowice and the Rudna Mine  infrastructure and the upgrade or modernization of Pyrometallurgy Project, which is to design to reduce the unit  cost of production and to fulfill more stringent environmental parameters. We're going to half the CO2 emissions  and this project is going to be completed in quarter three and four. Thank you.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: Prices denominated in U.S. dollars and the commodities' prices were declining and the sentiment to commodities  market was, to large extent, determined by the falling oil prices. This is usually correlated with added  commodities. And we heard more and more about the upcoming economic slowdown in China. As a result, we had  falling prices of copper, silver and molybdenum.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: However, it should be noted that the falling prices of commodities denominated in the USD had negative impact  only on some markets. However, the commodity prices in the local currencies were quite different. As you may see  in the slide, at the right-hand side, when you look up the copper prices in złotys or Chilean peso or Canadian  dollar, we may say that from January 2014, the copper price has been fairly stable.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: On top of that, analytical companies verified and [indiscernible] (16:12) their output productions coming from the  newly launched production sites. The delays of the mining projects are quite substantial. They take few years. On  this slide, you've got the mining projects that are beyond 50,000 tonnes of copper and, therefore, it is frequently  said that the surplus that was expected in 2015 and 2016 will be either negligible or we will actually face the  copper deficit on the market.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: You may recall that we've already shared with you our projections regarding output from new mines and we  estimate that we shall see that copper as deficit in the coming years. It'll be a structural deficit of copper.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: And now, if I may turn to our group performance. Let me emphasize the macroeconomic environment in which  our group has operated and specifically copper, silver and molybdenum prices denominated in U.S. dollars were  less conducive than in the same period of 2014. If we compare the prices of copper in Q1 2014 compared to 2015  the same period we see the drop of 17%.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: And if we move on to the next slide, we may say that in Q1 2015, we were able to deliver good production  numbers. The copper equivalent production increased by 4% across the group and Polska Miedz is 3%, while in  case of KGHM International, it's [ph] 12.5% (21:19) increase in copper equivalent production.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: As far as KGHM International is concerned, we've seen a clear improvement in the copper production. It is up by  13% compared to the same period of 2014. The Robinson mine produced ore from the Ruth site, and we may  remember that in Q1 2014, we were working on the Kimbley site. The Robinson mine has achieved the highest  historical ore production that was 49,000 tons per 24 hours, and it also improved their technological indicators  very substantially. Therefore, the production of TPM increased by 27%.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: Now let me move to the mother company financial performance. As I already said, that output has been very  stable and whilst we did note a decline in the copper content from 1.57% to 1.54%, the electrolytic copper  production has [ph] not been changed (30:17), 143,000 tonnes in the first quarter of 2014, 142,000 tonnes in Q1  2015, and the production from our own ore is at the same level. As I said, our production of silver has been  growing by 7%, and it results from us processing of silver-bearing ores, which we buy from outside and they are  richer in silver.

texts.speaker: Jarosław Romanowski
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Executive Vice President
texts.text: In this breakdown, I'd like to draw your attention to the fact that we had lower external energy costs by PLN 22  million. Why? Because 13% in volume terms was as much as we reduced the purchase of external energy because  we used our own combined cycle unit and the cost of generation was 30% – more than 30% lower than outside,  looking at the price of electricity. Obviously, that effect that was also a result of the company receiving yellow  certificates. So, again, with the yellow certificates, our generation cost of electricity was 30% lower than elsewhere  in the market.

file: KGH - Q1 2017 Earnings Call 8May2017 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-May-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Radoslaw Domagalski-Labedzki
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Thank you. I'd like to welcome all of you. Thank you for joining us and having interest in our presentation that is  summarizing the Q1 2017 results of KGHM Group. The first quarter by principle was a good time for KGHM  Group. On the year-to-year basis we see some decline in payable copper production by 3%, and this is because  of the lower production of KGHM International, especially at the Robinson site. Year-on-year production at  Robinson was down by 4.7%, almost 5,000 tones that led to the lower total payable copper production. So  consequently, the sales of payable copper is down by 2%. It was 151 tonne, and our revenue is up by nearly PLN  1 billion, and this is due to the higher copper prices globally and very conducive interest exchange rate. The weak  zloty really matters to KGHM more even than the copper prices.

texts.speaker: Radoslaw Domagalski-Labedzki
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: EBITDA was up by PLN 0.5 billion. It was PLN 1.581 billion, and again that was fueled by higher copper prices  and stable costs. I think that I should emphasize that at Sierra Gorda we were able to show increased EBITDA at  KGHM International financial results slightly deteriorated because of the lower payable copper production at  Robinson mine. So if we move on to the next slide, you are able to see all the macroeconomic factors that came  to play to our advantage on a year-to-year basis. And copper price was up by 25%, so over $1,250. So per tonne  this is a really sort of tailwind for us in Q1. It means that we survived the toughest time, and we have reasons to  be moderately optimistic for Q2 and Q3.

texts.speaker: Radoslaw Domagalski-Labedzki
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Now, speaking of the costs, the unit costs that really give testimony to our internal efficiency, in this slide, you may  see that at the group level here in Poland, at the local assets, the C1 unit costs went down. So the cost that we  are under control is PLN 0.83, but obviously there is so called the copper tax that is beyond our control, and it was  higher than in the same period of 2016. And as a result of this copper tax, the average C1 unit cost was the same  as in Q1 2016. However, looking at the economics year-to-year, we noted the cost reduction by 12%. So now  when we move to KGHM International, the unit cost went up substantially, and to some extent this is due to the  lower payable copper production at Robinson site. The cost increase was quite substantial. It was up by 61%.

texts.speaker: Radoslaw Domagalski-Labedzki
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: And again, when we look at Sierra Gorda, the cost was somewhat up. It was $1.97 per pound at the C1 level. So  that's due to the higher energy costs and some increased fixed costs. In this case, coal prices and molybdenum  processing price costs were also higher. However, we are happy to show better operation efficiency for  molybdenum and copper at Sierra Gorda. The average copper grade and copper production is 80%, but it was  85% at the end of Q1, and we were able to actually stabilize recovery of molybdenum. This is, as I said,  continuously our greatest operational challenge, but we were able to stabilize that. So it means that we are  actually getting to our target parameters of 40% recovery of molybdenum.

texts.speaker: Stefan Świątkowski
texts.profession: Vice President of the Management Board (Finance), KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: And speaking of EBITDA, most of the EBITDA movement are in line with the price changes. So please note for  minus PLN 400 million, this called as other, this is the negative impact on EBITDA, and quite frankly, this is mainly  increased energy price cost. In Sierra Gorda, we launched the second unit that was planned for Q1, so that's why  our energy prices and costs are up. Diesel prices are up. But we are actually doing stripping to open another field  at Robinson to improve our production result.

texts.speaker: Radoslaw Domagalski-Labedzki
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: In Sierra Gorda, we're also reaching stability. It's a difficult process. People often ask about Sierra Gorda.  However, while this project is still new to us, and when you think about this life of mine, there's going to be several  decades long. We're still in early days, and we have to look at it more broadly. However, still we are increasing  our most important parameters like yield, for example, in terms of copper and molybdenum. We need a little bit  more time to stabilize our main yield parameters. We need to work on bottlenecks that we still encounter in this  process, but still we will achieve progress.

So this phase has almost been completed. And further progress of the sea-water  pipeline and waste storage is at 25% completion. And as for their processing plant, we're on the level 30%.

We  received the agreement for almost 90%. And from the signed agreements what was paid is almost half, $2.4  billion. And this is the main information regarding the Sierra Gorda at today.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: At the same time, we are also running analysis, we are finalizing them, and they concern the development of Sierra  Gorda by two or three ball mills that will enable us to increase the daily processing from 110,000 tonnes up to  more than 200,000 of ore processed daily.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: As we have said, we talked about oxide ore processing. This ore was over the sulphur ore that is processed at the  moment. This project will help us to increase the production of Sierra Gorda by 40,000 tonnes yearly. And the  work are advanced up to 40% in terms of feasibility study. It is also worth emphasize the exploration potential. We  are running the works that we believe that will prolong, extend the life of the Sierra Gorda mine by documenting  additional resources deposits.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: We also implemented the value creation plan. And under this plan, we identified a field that are undergo  optimalization and we assigned them on the motivation system. And here, it is worth mentioning the  optimalization of the axis of the pit, also geological work optimization in terms of energy, electric energy in Sierra  Gorda mine, but we are also proud that we implemented the process of global purchases in Sierra Gorda mine.  The latest, the most recent and purchases of cars, lorries and shovels were very successful and they brought us $10  million in savings.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: Speaking of Victoria mine, we have completed during the third quarter of 2014 drilling a drift and, therefore, we  started the works in deepening the shaft. The shaft will be very deep. The depth will be 1,850 meters and it will  take three-and-a-half years to drill the shaft.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: We are here talking about 1,000 meters up to 1,800 meters depth. The mineralization is continued below 1,800  meters. We will – the area below 1,800 meters, we will be recognizing it along with deepening the shaft. But the  mine has got a very good economics for the defined mineralization between 1,000 meters and 1,800 meters of  depth. We are proud that the design works in terms of the shaft is done by the Polish company, and the deepening  is supervised by another Polish company, PeBeKa.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: In terms of costs, we are also building a central climatization ventilation station. We have also launched gas and  steam blocks recently in Polkowice and in Głogów. The total capability power is 1,000 megawatts. The total  production of those gas and steam blocks is 550 megawatts of the energy, but we have coal generation of 2 million  joules of heat. This is exactly beneath what KGHM Poland needs in terms of heat.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: Taking into consideration the current price of the yellow certificates obtaining energy from the gas-steam blocks,  comparing it to the current energy prices, we are able to produce the energy, of course, taking into consideration  the cost of the yellow certificates at about 25% lower than the market price. But in addition to the economy aspect,  we also take good care about security, so the blocks have been designed in order to be as secure as possible  because – thanks to the own power system, we are able to take the miners up to the ground if there is a blackout  risk at the end.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: Finally, it is worth to mention a new concession area that KGHM acquired. Recently on October 1, the Ministry of  Environment issued a decision providing KGHM Poland with concession to recognize the deposits of potassium  salts along with mineralization of copper, silver and rock salt. So, after the period, when the decision is fully  enforced, together with Azoty under the contract agreement that we have signed, so together with Azoty Group, we  want to manage this concession.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: We have the experience in exploration of rock salt in KGHM. We are experienced – we have experience in  deepening shafts as well as running the drills. And we are also experienced in processing. So, together with Azoty  Grupa, we have a good synergy, very good for managing one of the highest potassium salt deposits in Europe.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: Unit results, we will start with the level of the mining production. And despite the continued deterioration of  mining and geological conditions, especially the drop of copper content down to 154,000 tonnes for nine months  of this year, it dropped by 2.5%. It has been compensated by us by a higher production volume and systematic  improvement in flotation. Therefore, our company is proud to say that concentrate copper production was  320,000 tonnes, which was close to the previous year.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: Speaking of the refined ore production, this level has been higher than in the previous year. The own material  production was higher due to the fact that last year, the Głogów copper smelter was stopped. And this year we are  processing the purchased materials – high amount of purchased materials. And in comparing to the plants, we  had higher silver content.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: The main reason for the cost dropping comparing to the previous year is the energy, PLN 27 million; the plant  limitation of the preparation works by PLN 82 million. The work cost grew due to the gross of the indicator of  average work. This year we also had the memorial actuarial reserve  which was PLN 33 million.

texts.speaker: Maciej Konski
texts.profession: General Dir-Resource Base & Strategic Analyses Ctr
texts.text: The unit cost from own materials that shows the cost for the mining part and the electrolytic part, it is below the  level of the last year by 7%. This is due to the lower cost by nature and higher production volume by 2.5%. Own  materials, we had 8,000 tonnes copper more in production.

texts.speaker: Artur Tarnowski
texts.profession: Executive Director-Investor Relations
texts.text: Speaking about a long-term and middle-term perspectives of demand for those metals, they are very good. In  order to use properly the natural resources and to complete the investment project, we need staff. We have a very  good personnel, a very experienced in local projects, and this is very important with diversification of assets that  we have and the portfolio of new projects that we have.

texts.speaker: Artur Tarnowski
texts.profession: Executive Director-Investor Relations
texts.text: So, ending this slide, summarizing the most important, attractive elements, I need to say that our Polish assets  guarantee a stable production of copper, while projects such as Sierra Gorda that is not a project anymore, this is  up and running, this is a running mine, and new projects such as Victoria that are during the preparation stage  and will start – will be launched – launching production in 2019, are a very good idea for the future. They make us  think about the future as very safe.

texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: What I would like to underline at that point is the fact that, currently, China is a much bigger consumer of copper  in nominal terms than five years ago. texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: And what I would also like to bring to your attention is the fact that certain producers decided to limit production  level in the future. Well, it is quite likely that, before the end of this year, the reduction of supply will be bigger  than in 2014. So that will exceed 1 million tonnes of mining copper. What you can also see here is that investment  funds very frequently taking positions on future markets. I think that they anticipate the reduction of the prices of  commodities, and we have seen sort of a slower reduction of commodities market. And you can say that this  market is definitely below the line.

texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: Well, of course, what is of key importance for us in terms of our regions and the demand on copper in China,  almost 50% of the global consumption of copper. And if we see it in such a way that this copper consumption of  China, to a large extent, is correlated to the development of the economic growth in China, well, then in 2010, the  growth rate was 12%, whereas the last estimates, published estimates were below 7% or 6.9% for this year.

texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: The estimates published this year, anticipating the growth rate of zero and the physical market where we also  supply copper, we would not confirm it. And we believe that the growth of the consumption will be between 1% or  2%. So at least, under physical market, I think the on-the-spot market it shouldn't be as bad as that.

texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: And now let me discuss the financial results, economic results of KGHM. Well, we present what we know, the  decline of the prices of copper, 18%. And well, silver price declined by 17%. However, when we have a closer look  at copper prices denominated in zlotys, this decline is small. It is only 1%.

texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: We know that the main reason of the decline of molybdenum prices was lower demand on steel, as well as  discontinuation of certain investment projects in crude oil sector. We know that crude oil price dropped  significantly and refineries discontinued their investment and efforts. It's a huge market, in terms of molybdenum  consumption. Molybdenum is used in the desulfurization process and it acts as a catalyzer in this process.

texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: And the level of the cost in Polska Miedz in sort of comparable circumstances, practically speaking, this is the  same level than the last year in 2014. Nevertheless, we aim at optimizing our cost structure and would lower prices  of metals, the costs, well, across the group should be controlled in the future and we hope to be able to reduce  them.

texts.speaker: Jaroslaw Romanowski
texts.profession: First Vice President-Finance
texts.text: Costs, net of mineral extraction tax and without third-party feeds, at a very similar level, they would have been  lower if it wasn't for the increase of depreciation by PLN 59,000 as a result of our increased capital expenditure  and basically more assets that's why we have the same cost. But if we lo ok at it with – in the context of mineral  extraction tax and third-party products, it is 33% better.

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA

texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, KGHM Polska Miedz SA

texts.speaker: Piotr Walczak
texts.profession: Vice President-Production, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. I'm going to discuss two main areas of our operations and this is mining  and smeltering. Its aim is to ensure [ph]  ore (11:56) contribution until 2055 and perhaps even later. texts.profession: Vice President-Production, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
texts.text: Well, today the depth of the shop is 886 meters and what we have planned is 1,340 meters and the process of  sealing up the shaft continued using tubing construction and we want to have a proper drainage system to  prevent certain emergencies like the leakages and, well, the second element of this program, this is the second  stage of the construction, of the surface-based cooling station at R XI shaft and currently when we go below 1,200  meters without cooling, it does not [indiscernible] (13:03) the primary temperature of the rock is at 48 degrees.

texts.profession: Vice President-Production, KGHM Polska Miedz SA

texts.profession: Vice President-Production, KGHM Polska Miedz SA

texts.profession: Vice President-Production, KGHM Polska Miedz SA

We are, though, going to do our best to minimize, to mitigate the implications of such natural phenomenon and  that may occur in mining areas.

texts.profession: Vice President-Production, KGHM Polska Miedz SA

texts.profession: Vice President of the Management Board-Finance, KGHM Polska Miedz SA
