texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services
texts.text: Thank you, Björn, and good afternoon. Before discussing our first quarter numbers, I want to give you some  additional information relating to our communication last night. Daimler AG conducted an internal investigation  regarding its certification process related to exhaust emissions in the United States upon the request of the U.S.  Department of Justice. Daimler is cooperating fully with the authorities. Daimler will consequently investigate  possible indications of irregularities and, of course, take all necessary actions.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services
texts.text: We confirmed our forerunner role in connectivity with the world premiere of three connected and autonomous  driving trucks, driving as a platoon on the public highway. In addition, Daimler announced the next milestones in  electric mobility with the investment of €500 million in a second battery plant.

file: MBG - Q1 2017 Earnings Call 26April2017 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 26-Apr-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: We are working to safeguard and further improve our current performance step-by-step with a continuation of our  product offensive in all divisions and transformation of the entire Daimler Group with a focus on structural  optimization, efficiency improvements, and increasing operational flexibility. While we continue with our  comprehensive financial discipline, we are working and investing in future technologies, connectivity, autonomous  driving, shared and emission-free driving.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: At Mercedes-Benz Cars, we are moving ahead in the field of electric mobility. We are accelerating the launch of  series production for more than 10 new electric vehicles between now and 2022. At the same time, we are  increasing flexibility in our production facilities and are able to deal with the demand fluctuations.

file: MBG - Q1 2018 Earnings Call 27April2018 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Apr-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Björn Scheib
texts.profession: Head of Investor Relations, Daimler AG
texts.text: Before I hand over to Bodo, I would like to address the following comment on the diesel topic very briefly. There  are no new information regarding the ongoing investigation by the Stuttgart public prosecutor's office in  connection with diesel or our internal investigation upon the request of the U.S. Department of Justice. At the  same time, we published an update on the legal proceedings with our Annual Report 2017 and in our Q1 Interim  Report 2018. All our financial statements are reflecting our current financial assessment of these legal  proceedings.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: We took a step further towards the future of electric mobility with Mercedes-Benz eActros, our customers are  currently testing the heavy duty electric truck, it's everyday usability and economic efficiency under real life  conditions of course. The locally emission-free eActros could go into serious production as soon as 2021.

file: MBG - Q1 2019 Earnings Call 26April2019 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 26-Apr-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Particularly noteworthy is that the development of our mobility services in the first quarter of 2019. Together with  BMW Group, we are pooling our mobility services to create a new global player providing sustainable urban  mobility services for our customers. We are intermeshing our offerings for car sharing, ride hailing, parking,  charging and multi-modal transport. We want to create a relevant player with already more than 66 million  customers worldwide.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: In the course of our electric offensive, we are expanding the global battery production network of Mercedes-Benz  Cars to nine factories on three continents by opening a new battery factory in Jawor in Poland. In order to adapt  to all market changes and driving technologies rapidly, we have opened a new car plant in Moscow that features  flexible and green production and will apply modern Industry 4.0 technologies.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: In addition, ongoing governmental proceedings and measures taken for diesel vehicles had a negative impact on  earnings. Higher unit sales made a positive contribution to earnings.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: From the Mercedes-Benz Vans and portfolio electrification perspective, we are looking forward to the second half  of this year. We presented the Concept EQV in Geneva. Our aim is that the series-produced EQV model will have  its worldwide premiere in the Frankfurt Motor Show this September.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Daimler Buses anticipates a significant increase in unit sales for 2019. This is based on the slight sales growth in  the EU30 region and a significantly positive sales trend in India. Unit sales in Latin America, excluding Mexico,  are expected to remain at previous year's level. The eCitaro can be ordered as of now and Daimler Buses has  already received a record-breaking order to supply 56 electric urban eCitaro buses to the city of Wiesbaden in the  second quarter.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Zhejiang Geely Holding Group to own, operate and further develop smart, the pioneer of small urban cars, as a  leader of premium electrified vehicles. Under this joint venture agreement, a new generation of smart models will  be assembled at a new purpose-built electric car factory in China with global sales due to the – begin in 2022.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer and Member, Management Board, Finance & Controlling and Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: The course has been set for project future to give all our divisions greater entrepreneurial freedom and positioning  them even closer to their markets and customers to develop further revenue and business potential. Further  concrete benefits include the divisional companies' increased management accountability due to the dedicated  decision-making boards in the new entity as well as their ability to enter focused partnerships and cooperations if  necessary. Moreover, we will only be successful in the long term if we align the group even more strongly towards  sustainability in all dimensions.

file: MBG - Q2 2010 Earnings Call 27July2010 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Jul-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: 2 Let’s now take a closer look, starting with our passenger cars division.  Mercedes-Benz Cars  posted EBIT of €1.4 billion in the second quarter.  Return on sales was 9.8%.  In other words, this  is already very close to our financial target of 10%.  And with our almost-complete renewal of our  product portfolio in the coming years, we’re confident to post those 10% on a sustainable basis  from the end of 2012 onwards.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Now let’s get to the outlook. What do we expect for the second half of the year? At this point, most  available indicators suggest that the upswing of the world economy will continue.  That’s why we  expect global demand for passenger cars to grow by approximately 8% in 2010. In Western  Europe, the end of scrappage schemes will dampen demand, but that will mostly be on the low end       corrected transcript

file: MBG - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 27July2011 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Jul-11.pdf
MBG - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 25July2012 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Jul-12.pdf
MBG - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 24July2013 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 24-Jul-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: We also have best-in-class truck products in other regions. NAFTA, our new Cascadia Evolution sets another  benchmark for fuel efficiency; consumes 7% less compared to its predecessor, which itself was a very efficient  truck. Our customers appreciate that. As of today, we have roughly 15,000 firm orders on our books.

file: MBG - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 23July2014 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 23-Jul-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: So we are well on the way to achieving our sales goals. Now, it's about further improving our cost position. To that  end, we are systematically implementing the measures of our efficiency programs in all of our divisions. We will  reach our communicated and immediate targets by the end of 2014. At the same time, we continue to further  develop our programs.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: A few words on our immediate targets. With Fit for Leadership at passenger cars, we will save €2 billion in cost. At  the end of the second quarter, we had already achieved 55% of our planned savings. With that, we are well on our  way to getting the 70% to 80% of the total cost savings plan for 2014.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: We're also prepared for fully electric driving. Our Denza will enter the Chinese market in September. The new B  Class electric trucks already available in the U.S. with market launch in Germany will be at the end of 2014, and  we will roll out our future cars in 2017.

file: MBG - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 23July2015 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 23-Jul-15.pdf
MBG - Q2 2016 Earnings Call 21July2016 1000 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 21-Jul-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: In autonomous driving, we demonstrate our leadership time and time again. On Monday, we introduced the  world's first partially autonomous bus. Today, we already have several hundred experts working to enhance the  artificial intelligence of our vehicles. With car2go, we lead our industry in car sharing. In the future, the  combination of autonomous driving and car sharing has immense potential. In the coming years, we will  massively accelerate the pace of transformation of our powertrains from combustion to electric drive.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Over the next three years, we will invest €14.5 billion in the research and development at Daimler, the major part  of which will flow into green technologies. At the Auto Show in Paris, we will introduce an electric concept car with  a 500-kilometer range. There, we will also have our new electric drive smart models on display. The launches  begin at the end of the year.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: In addition, at Mercedes-Benz, we are working on a new architecture for an all-electric vehicle family.  Electrification is also picking up in our commercial vehicles. More to come on that later this month and at this IAA  in Hanover in September.

file: MBG - Q2 2017 Earnings Call 26July2017 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 26-Jul-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: At Mercedes-Benz Cars, our product offensive continues in 2018, above all, in the compact-car segment. With our  new architecture, we are increasing the number of our compact cars from five to eight models. In our path toward  emission-free mobility, we continue to focus on the three effective pillars: highly efficient combustion engines,  plug-in hybrids and full electric drives. At present, the public debate about diesel is creating uncertainty, especially  for the customers. This topic is highly complex, both technically and legally. We have been working on it  systematically in internal investigations for a long time and we are fully cooperating with the authorities.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Regarding the future of diesel engines, we are focused on the innovative strength of our engineers. Our new  diesel engine, OM 654, is a good example that technical improvements can achieve more than driving Benz. In  addition, we took proactive steps last week with the announcement of specific measures. With the software  updates, we are making use of the latest findings in this field and from the development of our new engine  generation. This enabled us to significantly reduce the NOx emissions of our Euro 5 and Euro 6 diesel vehicles  under normal driving conditions.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Of course, diesel engines have to be assessed in terms of their NOx and CO2 emissions. But when that is done  objectively, it becomes clear that diesel engines are worth fighting for. That's why we advocate for them in our  customers' interest, not because we have to, but because it's the right thing to do.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: In addition, we continue to push forward with the electrification of our fleet. Our electric truck goes into production  this year in limited volume. Next year, it's our electric bus and more than 10 electric cars will go into series  production by 2022.

file: MBG - Q2 2018 Earnings Call 26July2018 915 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 26-Jul-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Due to several factors, some temporary restrictions in the availability of vehicles will occur as the year progresses.  That also means that some of our customers have to switch to vehicles with lower margins. Among others, these  factors include: the known delivery hold for some diesel models and challenges in the supply chain. Furthermore,  certification of vehicles in some international markets currently requires longer preparation than usual.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: For longer time periods, emissions have been a major focus. Many of our colleagues have been working intensely  on software updates, the changeover to the new European test standard WLTP, and on the technical and legal  clarification of open questions. Therefore, the certification of our new models has, in part, not yet advanced as far  as expected.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: With the very same determination, we are driving forward the electrification of our vehicles. In the second quarter,  we both introduced two new electric trucks for the U.S. market and created an e-mobility unit for trucks. Two  weeks ago, we introduced the eActros, the first all-electric city bus. Orders from some cities had already come in  before its premiere. And this development is continuing. In just two years, we will already equip the eActros with  the next level of technology and offer two different battery technologies, and whence we will start delivery of the  eVito in September. The eSprinter will follow next year.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: As of May, our electric smart cars are the first EQ models on the road. In the future, we will also produce a  compact Mercedes electric model at our smart plant in France. And this September, our first electric Mercedes,  EQC will celebrate its world premiere in Stockholm.

file: MBG - Q3 2010 Earnings Call QA Session 28October2010 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Oct-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Nevertheless, Daimler Trucks North America was able to strengthen its market share in the  medium and heavy-duty segments due to the favorable reception of the new EPA10 engines. Our  efficiency enhancement shows benefits above and beyond our repositioning programs in NAFTA  and Asia, which are on track or even ahead of schedule.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: The product portfolio of Mercedes-Benz Cars is proving itself to be very attractive and competitive.  It gives us the confidence to increase our 2010 unit sales for the Mercedes-Benz brand by a  double-digit rate compared to 2009. The division will continue to benefit from strong sales and good  margins, as well as from the positive effects from our successfully implemented efficiency  programs. On the other hand, we expect seasonally higher marketing and services costs in addition  to relatively higher product-related expenditures in connection with CO2 related technologies and  upcoming product changeovers. Taking this into account, we expect a divisional EBIT of  approximately €4.5 billion for the fiscal year 2010.

file: MBG - Q3 2011 Earnings Call 27October2011 630 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Oct-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo Uebber
texts.profession: Director-Finance & Controlling, Daimler AG
texts.text: Now, let's start discussing the performance of our divisions in the third quarter. Mercedes-Benz Cars continued its  positive business development and set a new record with unit sales of 337,000 vehicles in the third quarter. The  Mercedes-Benz brand also posted a new record, selling 315,000 units. Mercedes-Benz Cars posted an EBIT of €1.1  billion with a return on sales of 8% despite substantial headwinds, such as product changeovers, increased  material and currency costs. In September, we started deliveries of the new M-Class to our U.S. dealers. The  roadster version of the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG was followed in the fourth quarter.  In November, we will launch the new B-Class, the first of five new models in the compact-car segment. We're also  introducing our particularly fuel efficient 4, 6, and 8-cylinder engines and the eco-start-stop technology in  additional models. In the new generation C-Class, for example, the C 220 CDI delivers fuel consumption of just  4.4 liters to 100 kilometers and CO2 emissions of only 117 grams per kilometer. Production is in the fast lane. We  anticipate strong production in the coming months. We are targeting sales at a record level of 1.35 million units  for the full year 2011.

texts.speaker: Bodo Uebber
texts.profession: Director-Finance & Controlling, Daimler AG
texts.text: Daimler Trucks expects to post significant growth in unit sales in full-year 2011. Sales in Q4 '11 are expected to  exceed the prior level based on our good order situation and stabilization of the Japanese market. For Q4 2011, we  expect EBIT at a higher level than last year. While we expect higher sales, we have to deal with burdens associated  with emission technologies, the expansion in gross markets, as well as cost seasonality at year-end.

file: MBG - Q3 2012 Earnings Call 25October2012 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Oct-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimer Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: So much for the current developments in various divisions. Next, what does the more difficult macro environment  mean for our full-year results? The economic climate at the beginning of the fourth quarter still features  uncertainty. Thanks to the robust development year-to-date, we expect an increase in worldwide registrations of  new cars in the magnitude of 4% to 5% for the full year, mainly driven by China and the U.S. market. We expect  Mercedes-Benz Cars to post higher unit sales than in the prior-year period. We will benefit from the strong  demand for our SUVs, the C-Class, and our new compact class.

texts.speaker: Bodo Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimer Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: One example is the net-zero approach, which we outlined to you at our capital market in Hungary. We have  accelerated this initiative to achieve the goal at an earlier point in time. Two other measures are that we further  intensify our efforts to improve productivity in terms of hours per vehicle and to reduce overhead costs.

file: MBG - Q3 2013 Earnings Call 24October2013 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 24-Oct-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: The picture in the trucks markets was rather mixed. The North American market showed no upward dynamic and  remained below the previous year. Positive developments in Western Europe were mainly driven by purchases  being brought forward in connection with the upcoming introduction of Euro VI emission regulations. Brazil  continues on its growth track, mainly decoupled from the otherwise relatively weak economic development. Japan  showed a strong increase from the relative low basis last year.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: Sales of our electric vehicles are also encouraging. Sales increased from around 1,000 electric vehicles in 2012 to  2,500 in just the first nine months of 2013. Our electric smart is particularly successful, capturing a market share  of over 40% in Germany. Next year we will launch the electric B-Class, which you could see at the Frankfurt Auto  Show.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: Next let's turn to our Commercial Vehicle businesses. We have now completed all major product renewals, and  today we have our strongest product lineup ever. All European trucks come with Euro VI technology and with  best-in-class fuel economy. In North America our new Cascadia Evolution also underscores our fuel efficiency  leadership by achieving a 7% improvement in fuel consumption versus its predecessor. Customers are also  convinced. We have already received almost 20,000 orders.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: While our top line benefits from new product introductions, we continue our efficiency programs to ensure that  growth from new products will also translate to higher profitability on our bottom line. As you know, in 2013 we  aim to realize 30% of the targeted benefits of €2 billion at Mercedes-Benz Cars and €1.6 billion at Daimler Trucks.  The implementation of our efficiency initiatives is fully on track. In the first three quarters of the year 70% of the  planned cost savings have already been achieved at Mercedes-Benz Passenger Cars and 60% at Daimler Trucks. In  2014 we will take another step forward, and in 2015 we expect to realize the full benefits of the divisional  programs.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: In Europe we some pull forward in sales associated with the introduction of the Euro VI emission regulations, and  we are carefully monitoring the development. To optimize our capacity utilization we are currently allocating  orders for Euro VI trucks to the first quarter 2014. Mercedes-Benz Vans expects to continue to deal with a  challenging market environment in Western Europe. Daimler Buses will benefit from the recovery in the chassis  business in Latin America.

file: MBG - Q3 2014 Earnings Call 23October2014 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 23-Oct-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management of Daimler AG, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services
texts.text: We also keep pressing forward with our alternative drivetrain strategy when we launched the S500 Plug-in  Hybrid. In September, we announced we will launch a total of 10 Plug-in Hybrid models by 2017. We are very  confident in this technology and expect to reach six digit annual sales figures by the end of this decade.

file: MBG - Q3 2015 Earnings Call 22October2015 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 22-Oct-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services
texts.text: To sum up the third quarter, we continue to grow profitable and are continually developing our business model. In  light of the recent news, I'd like to say a few words about our diesel technology. Daimler does not use and have  never used defeat devices, which illegally limit the effectiveness of the emission control system. This applies to all  of our diesel and gasoline engines worldwide.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services
texts.text: We place great importance on conducting our business with integrity, and comply with ethical laws and  regulations. We consider the diesel engine to be, and remain, an important fuel-efficient technology that plays a  crucial part in achieving the climate goals. At the same time, current discussions also confirm our strategy to  invest in and develop a broad portfolio of future powertrain technologies.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services
texts.text: We also keep pressing forward with our alternative drive train strategy. Of the 10 plug-in hybrid models we will  bring to the market by 2017, five will be launched by the end of this year. Additionally, we are working on an  intelligent vehicle concept with a range of 400 kilometers and more as basis for an electric vehicle architecture.

file: MBG - Q3 2016 Earnings Call 21October2016 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 21-Oct-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: At the Paris Motor Show, we presented our new product brand for electric mobility EQ and the amazing concept  car. Before the end of this decade, the first EQ model will be launched in the SUV segment followed by a model  offensive that will gradually supplement the Mercedes-Benz Cars portfolio with electrified vehicles.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: As order intakes in the third quarter indicate a continuation of the challenging NAFTA market in the coming  months, we initiated additional steps at Daimler Trucks North America to adjust our production program  accordingly. Besides those market developments, we presented our new flagship in the heavy-duty segment, the  new Freightliner Cascadia, which sets new standards for fuel efficiency in the Class 8 market.

file: MBG - Q3 2017 Earnings Call 20October2017 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 20-Oct-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Björn Scheib
texts.profession: Head of Investor Relations, Daimler AG
texts.text: Before I hand over to Bodo, I would like to address the following comment on the diesel topic very briefly. There is  no new additional information regarding the ongoing investigation by the Stuttgart public prosecutor's office in  connection with the diesel or our internal investigation upon the request of the U.S. Department of Justice. As all  of you are aware of the statement on this subject, we are fully continuing to cooperate with the authorities. Our  experience has clearly shown that our conservative communication approach supports the constructive dialogue  with all the authorities. So therefore, please understand that we do not comment on pending proceedings and  cannot provide any additional further details.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member of the Board of Management, Finance & Controlling/Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: With Fit for Leadership 4.0, we prepared a comprehensive transformation of the automobile business. This  comprises a boost of the EV vehicle share, as well as rising hybridization and CO2 measures and the  corresponding impact on the profitability of Mercedes-Benz. Therefore our important goal of Fit for Leadership 4.0  is to secure the profitability of the current portfolio to be best prepared for the upcoming challenges.

file: MBG - Q3 2018 Earnings Call 25October2018 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Oct-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: The first glimpse of the all-new GLE were disclosed at its premiere in September, which premiered at the Paris  Motor Show. And in Stockholm, we presented the first major step of our strategy towards electrification, the EQC,  our first all-electric vehicle of the EQ brand.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: This September, Mercedes-Benz Vans put its new plant in North Charleston in U.S. State of South Carolina into  operation. And with the all-new eCitaro, Daimler buses are shaping the future of public transport. It's all-electric  and achieves a minimum range of 150 kilometers and the first orders have already been placed.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Furthermore, burns in connection with ongoing governmental proceedings and measures, including those for  diesel vehicles as well as expenses in connection with the possible need to take action on certain vehicles still  operating with the previously used refrigerant R134a impacted earnings at Mercedes passenger cars and  Mercedes-Benz Vans in the magnitude of a mid-three-digit million amount.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: The Van division's EBIT amount to minus €93 million. Earnings were impacted by expenses for the Sprinter model  change and by expenses in connection with ongoing governmental proceedings and measures taken for diesel  vehicles as well as by lower unit sales caused by delivery delays.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Daimler Financial Services anticipates further growth in contract volume for 2018, with new business expected to  be in the magnitude of the previous year. Based on the generally positive sales assumptions, we expect the  Daimler Group to post a slight increase in revenue for the year 2018. We are committed to the environment and  air quality as well as to individual mobility.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Mercedes-Benz Cars has started to offer an exchange premium for diesel vehicles of up to €10,000 in certain  German regions. The company will also participate in the hardware retrofit program.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: Due to the previously mentioned expenses in connection with the ongoing governmental proceedings and  measures in various regions with regard to diesel vehicles, delivery delays and the provisions recognized related  to the refrigerant R134a, we have reassessed our guidance.

texts.speaker: Bodo K. Uebber
texts.profession: Member, Board of Management, Finance & Controlling, Daimler Financial Services, Daimler AG
texts.text: The future is electric. With a well-received EQC, we have taken the first step towards it but it definitely won't be  the last. Our electrification strategy is on track with 10 battery electric models in our lineup by 2022.

file: MBG - Q4 2009 Earnings Call 18February2010 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 19-Feb-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Our second strategic lever is pioneering technologies and business models. For decades, we have  been leading the way forward in quality technology. We aim to play the same role in the area of  sustainable mobility, and we have a clear strategy for achieving our goal. We’re optimizing  combustion engines. We’re supplementing them with hybrid-drives and we’re developing and  producing fully electric vehicles that are locally emission-free, built with battery powered electric  drive, or with fuel cells.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: In all of these areas, we are making very good progress. In 2009, we reduced our Mercedes-Benz  Cars fleet emissions by 13 grams to 160 grams. And we continue to forge ahead here. For  example, the new six and eight cylinder engines scheduled for launch in 2010 will consume up to  25% less fuel than their respective predecessors.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: We aim to reduce our average fleet CO2 emissions to less than 140 grams by 2012, which will not  only meet legislative requirements, but actually exceed them. Naturally, our long-term goal remains  zero emission driving, and we are making progress here as well. Since the end of 2009, Smart  brand electric vehicles have been proving themselves on a daily-use basis in Berlin.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Still, there are two major hurdles to electric mobility based on fuel cells and batteries. For drive  systems powered exclusively by batteries, it’s the performance of the energy storage unit, as well  as its price. And for both battery powered vehicles and fuel cells drives, it’s the establishment of an  appropriate infrastructure. We’re addressing both issues, and we’re doing so in collaboration with  strong partners.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Let me give you just a few examples. Together with Evonik, we are now building Europe’s biggest  factory for lithium-ion batteries in the city of Kamenz in the German state of Saxony. We’re also  working with Linde and other partners to set up a hydrogen filling station network in Germany.  Together with energy suppliers such as RWE and Enel, we are working hard to establish charging  stations for battery-powered vehicles. In addition, partnerships like these make it possible to  increase the expertise at our disposal by sharing the huge costs associated with the development  of green technology.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Daimler alone invests well over €4 billion in research and development every year. It therefore goes  without saying that we are determined to ensure that every cent spent will be spent wisely. That’s  why we don’t just develop green technology. We also make it profitable. For example, through  large-scale modularization. Our commitment here will pay off in the end. No other automaker is as  well-positioned across the entire range of sustainable drive systems as Daimler.

file: MBG - Q4 2010 Earnings Call 16February2011 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 16-Feb-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.profession: Operator
texts.text: Based on today’s assumptions, Daimler is expecting to post an EBIT from ongoing business in  2011 significantly above 2010. Of course, there will be constraining factors. Higher raw material,  energy and logistics costs, higher R&D and CapEx mainly due to spending related to CO2  emissions reduction, higher spending in connection with model change-overs, as well as higher  personnel cost.

file: MBG - Q4 2011 Earnings Call 9February2012 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 09-Feb-12.pdf
MBG - Q4 2012 Earnings Call 7February2013 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 07-Feb-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: At the same time, it is important to ensure that our growth also turns into higher future profitability. That's why  the growth strategies of all our divisions include an efficiency program as a key component. In our Car business,  for example, we've complemented our growth strategy Mercedes-Benz 2020 with an efficiency initiative, Fit for  Leadership.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Daimler AG
texts.text: In general, we will enforce and accelerate both established and new efficiency measures. As a prime example,  you'll recall the net-zero approach we outlined at our last Capital Market Day in Hungary. The original target of  this approach was to offset cumulative material cost headwinds with efficiencies by 2017. Now we have  accelerated this initiative. As a result we will be able to achieve this goal two years sooner. That means our  cumulated cost increase by 2015 will already be balanced by increased efficiencies at that time.

file: MBG - Q4 2013 Earnings Call 7February2014 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 07-Feb-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: From Mercedes-Benz trucks, the Euro VI emission standard was the most important issue in 2013. The standard  went into effect in January 2014, months before we had already become the first truck manufacturer in Europe to  make our entire product range Euro VI compliant. Nearly half of new Actros vehicles sold in Europe in 2013  where delivered as Euro VI versions. In Germany, there was a full three out of four.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: And for good reason, normally the use of exhaust treatment technology increases fuel consumption, but we  managed to reduce emissions and save fuel at the same time. As a result, we offer our customers the best total cost  of ownership in the truck sector. Ultimately, that is the business rationale that sells trucks.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: The central element of Mercedes-Benz 2020 is the efficiency program, Fit for Leadership. For 2013, our goal was  to realize 30% of our total targeted cost savings. In the final tally, we realized €800 million of efficiency  improvements so we significantly over-achieved the target.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Next, let's look at our third strategic pillar, our vision of emission-free and accident-free driving. We are very well  positioned in both. Consider electric mobility, thanks to smart, we are the market leader in battery-powered cars  in Germany. We had a market share of around 30% in 2013.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: This year we'll see the market launch of the B-Class Electric Drive. This vehicle can stand up to any competitor. It  boasts a range of roughly 200 kilometers, generous stowage place, and short charging times. In short it's got  everything an electric car needs for everyday use.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: We've also made big progress in recent years with excellent combustion engines. More than 50 Mercedes-Benz  models now emit less than 120 grams of CO2 per kilometer.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: This fall we will launch the cleanest S-Class ever, the S500 Plug-In Hybrid, which emits only 69 grams of CO2 per  kilometer. The average CO2 emissions of our fleet of new cars in Europe amounted to 134 grams per kilometer last  year, 6 grams less than in 2012. We'll reduce this figure to 125 grams in 2016.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: In the commercial vehicle sector fuel efficiency is definitely the top priority. However efficient engines aren't the  only opportunity to cut emissions. For example we believe that effective telematic systems also have a great  potential for reducing CO2 emissions.

file: MBG - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 6February2015 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 06-Feb-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: In addition to the sedan and coupe, we are growing our family of flagship cars with addition of the Mercedes - Maybach S-Class. The top model is the S600. Its V12 powertrain generates 530 horsepower. Ho wever, the S-Class  also offers a completely different drive mode. As a plug-in hybrid, the car has the performance numbers of a V8,  but the fuel efficiency of a compact. You can drive more than 30 kilometers completely emission-free.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: Turning now to our commercial vehicles, the most-important event to the year was the IAA in Hannover. The  highlight of our show was the Mercedes-Benz Future Truck 2025. We revealed the design of this autonomous  truck, following a demonstration drive in Magdeburg back in July. With our autonomous driving Future Truck, we  provide a realistic look at where long-haul trucking is heading, and to a future that will be even more efficient,  safer and better networked.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: In October, DTNA booked about 31,300 orders for Class 6-8 trucks. That is the highest monthly order rate ever  recorded, not just for DTNA, but for the U.S. truck industry altogether. That's thanks in large part to a Mercedes  Cascadia Evolution. This truck is the most fuel efficient in its class and, therefore, has a very competitive total cost  of ownership.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: Another arena in which we define performance is electric mobility. And here, we also have a well-defined strategy.  Our technology of choice is plug-in hybrid. The S-Class was our first plug-in hybrid. Four weeks ago in Detroit, we  took another important step forward. Our new C-Class plug-in hybrid boasts a total power output of 279  horsepower, a combined torque of 600 Newton meters, but fuel consumption of just 2.1 liters per 100 kilometers.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: The plug-in hybrid concept offers the lion's share of advantages of electric driving. Thanks to the combustion  engine, it also eliminates the disadvantages pure electric drives will still have today, namely a limited range and  recharging infrastructure.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: Hybrid models have the strongest growth in the electric car market, and we assume the segment will continue to  grow significantly. By 2017, we'll have introduced 10 new plug-in hybrids to the market. Before you reach for your  calculators, that's an average of one new hybrid model every four months.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: Still the standard for truck technology will continue to be set in the triad. It's here that customers are most  demanding. The most-important selling point is fuel efficiency, as diesel alone accounts for about 30% of the total  cost of ownership. That's why, we optimize our trucks for fuel efficiency, and it pays off. In each and every triad  market, we are the champions of efficiency.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: Japan, our new FUSO heavy-duty Super Great V is the only truck in the market that betters the new 2015 fuel  efficiency standard by as much as 5%. In North America, our Freightliner Cascadia Evolution uses 7% less fuel  than its predecessor model and less than any of its competitors.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: And here, in Europe, we've sent our Mercedes-Benz Actros into the so-called Fuel Duels. We put Actros up head to  head against the most-fuel-efficient truck in our customers' fleet in real world use. We did so nearly 600 times last  year. Actros won the full 90% of these match-ups with an average of 11% fuel savings.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman-Management Board, Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars
texts.text: In addition in the U.S., we established the concept of integrated powertrains. For decades, American customers  purchased trucks as follows; the engine came from manufacturer A, the transmission from manufacturer B, and  the axle from manufacturer C. We fundamentally changed this business model. We convinced more and more  customers of the advantages of buying a complete driveline from one source, the chief argument being that you get  better fuel efficiency through perfectly-matched components.

file: MBG - Q4 2015 Earnings Call 5February2016 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-Feb-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Meanwhile, in alternative drive technology, we are forging ahead with plug-in hybrids. In 2017, we'll have 10 plug- in hybrids in the market. We believe this concept provides the best everyday utility of all alternative drives. That's  why we see it as the most successful autonomous drive technology over the next decades. With it, we will  further  decrease our vehicle CO2 emissions. At the end of last year, our average emissions in Europe stood at 123 grams  per kilometer, meaning we already overachieved the 2016 target in 2015. At the same time, we are working on a  dedicated architecture for an electric car with a range of up to 500 kilometers. That's part of that €4.7  billion  in  research and development we invested in our passenger car business in 2015.

file: MBG - Q4 2016 Earnings Call 3February2017 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Feb-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: In terms of electric mobility, we have flipped the switch. Daimler will invest €10 billion in electric vehicles and  another €1 billion beyond that in our worldwide battery production. With our new Mercedes brand, EQ, we are  creating an entire electric ecosystem from inductive charging to private energy storage. By 2025, we will have  introduced more than 10 new electric models to the market. By that time, we expect 15% to 25% of all newly  registered cars for Mercedes to be powered by electric drive.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: The same is true for Daimler as a whole. In all areas, we want to not only enhance today's business, but also  heavily invest in our future business. At the beginning of next decade, our first heavy-duty electric truck will be  ready for production. Meanwhile, 300 of our colleagues are working on new ideas for the connected trucks.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management of Daimler AG. Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Our largely autonomous future bus shows how our public transit system could look in the future. In addition, we  will launch our first electric bus in 2018. And beyond that, we're expanding our mobility services.

file: MBG - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 2February2018 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 02-Feb-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Daimler Trucks sales amounted to 471,000 trucks in 2017. With little support from the markets, that is a  remarkable result. We're able to affirm or build on our strong market position in almost all markets. We are also  able to raise Daimler Trucks EBIT to €2.4 billion. With efficiency measures we've introduced, particularly at  Mercedes-Benz Trucks, there's a good chance to achieve our target level also in terms of profitability.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Our 2017 results show our company is fundamentally healthy and highly profitable, but that's no reason to stand  still. We are driving change in all areas at Daimler. We are changing to stay what we are, number one in auto  mobility. In doing so, we are relying on four closely linked strategic building blocks that result in a whole. We all  call it our 4C approach.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman of the Board of Management & Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: The pace is also fast on the topic of electric mobility. Over the next few years, we will invest more than €10 billion  in the expansion of our electric fleet. By 2022, we will electrify the entire Mercedes portfolio. We'll offer at least 50  variants of electrified vehicles. By 2020, we will transform smart into the first car brand in Europe and the U.S. to  completely switch to electric. We're also electrifying our vans, trucks and buses with the same determination and  rapid pace. All of this goes to show, we'd already flipped the switch in the direction of e-mobility some time ago,  and we have much more to come.

file: MBG - Q4 2018 Earnings Call 7February2019 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 07-Feb-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: To sum it up, the demand for our cars continues to be very high. However, the general conditions for our business  were anything but easy in 2018. During the transition to WLTP, some deliveries to our dealers are subject to  delays. Therefore, we temporarily had significantly higher vehicle inventory. In the meantime, it's largely returned  to normal levels. Beyond that, in Germany in particular, there has been much discussion about air quality. Daimler  stands by its responsibility. We've initiated comprehensive measures ranging from software updates and an  exchange program for older diesel models to financial support for hardware retrofits by third parties.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Most importantly, as of today, 90% of the Mercedes-Benz portfolio in Europe has already been certified according  to 6d or 6d-TEMP. But, of course, this is also reflected in our earnings. Besides the expenses in connection with  ongoing government proceedings and measures relating to diesel vehicles, our EBIT was affected by  expenditures for new technologies and future products, exchange rate effects, weaker net pricing, and higher raw  material costs.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: And that brings me straight to our outlook. How good the teams can best be shown in difficult times, and last year,  the Daimler team had enough opportunity to make this proof, and they have done very well. That will serve us  well for this year. Of course, the environment remains extremely challenging. Therefore, we will continue to  intensively work on our efficiency with countermeasures in our automotive divisions. At the same time, we will  push ahead with the four key topics, future topics of our industry, connectivity, autonomous driving, sharing, and  e-mobility.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: And on the topic of e-mobility, we have totally gone on the offensive. In just a few weeks the EQC will drive off the  line in Bremen. In the course of this year, series production of the EQC will also launch in Beijing. By 2022, we will  electrify our complete range of passenger cars. In total, we'll offer more than 130 electrified vehicles.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Our commercial vehicles electric product range already stands alone in the industry. And Mercedes-Benz eActros  and the first electric vehicles from our Freightliner brand are currently in testing with customers in their day-to-day  work. We aim to start series production of these trucks in two years' time.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: All our commercial vans will also be available with electric drive in the future. As for our buses, the eCitaro is  already in series production. The basis for our EV ramp up in all vehicle segments is access to state-of-the-art  battery cells in large quantities, and we have our supplies secured until 2030. We are buying battery cells for a  total sum of more than €20 billion. Meanwhile, we continue to expand our own battery production. In the future,  we'll manufacture them in nine factories on three continents.

texts.speaker: Dieter Zetsche
texts.profession: Chairman, Board of Management; Head of Mercedes-Benz Cars, Daimler AG
texts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, the groundwork for a successful future is always created in the present. And right now, we  are setting our course for the next decade. For Daimler, 2019 will be a year of big change. We're structuring our  company anew, we're accelerating into the new era of electric mobility, we're driving connectivity, autonomous  driving and mobility services to new levels. Each of these topics open-up enormous potential for Daimler to shape  the future.

texts.profession: Investor & Analyst Relations Contact, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA
texts.text: Now, to give you some more context behind the numbers, slide 14. Looking at the Champagne business  specifically, volumes were stable in the first half of 2013 compared to the year-ago period. This reflects resilience  in Europe, despite the difficult economic climate, and strong growth in key Asian markets.

texts.speaker: Jean-Jacques Guiony
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer
texts.text: I would like to conclude this brief overview of the activity with a few comments on H1 performance, highlighting  the most important points for the future. I would tell that first and foremost, I do not think I will surprise anyone by  saying that the global environment is quite challenging. It is particularly true in terms of currencies where the  traditional answer of adjusting prices to fluctuations in currencies is not valid anymore. It doesn't mean that we  have no pricing power; it means that we should take a long-term view on reflecting currency fluctuations and  prices.

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good evening ladies and gentlemen, very pleased to welcome you this year for the publication of
texts.text: So what’s going to happen in 2010? The business climate is rather difficult to predict, the recovery,  the most talented, the most renowned economists have differing views on the – as to the strength  of the recovery. Will it continue and all the stimulus packages, will they be left without any attempt  to recover those sums.

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good evening ladies and gentlemen, very pleased to welcome you this year for the publication of
texts.text: So, the other brands where very negatively impacted by the business climate. A highlight in 2009  consumer demand that dipped as compared to ‘08 and ‘07 and what’s more destocking in the multi- brand retailers as we’ve indicated, hence the importance of tracking the sell-out of our brands in  these retailers where stocks of our brands down.

file: MC - Q4 2010 Earnings Call 4February2011 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 04-Feb-11.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault, Chairman and Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning, ladies and gentlemen. Thank you for having accepted this invitation this morning to
texts.text: We also have a very responsible policy in terms of the environment, not for me to get into the  details, but we’ve always been very much committed to protecting the environment and we indeed  have our own environmental Charter. And as I said, we’re very committed to that policy. A policy  not just for protecting the environment, we also have a policy of diversity. We are concerned with  preserving diversity in this organization and we are fortunate to have many women in this group.

file: MC - Q4 2011 Earnings Call 2February2012 1200 PM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 02-Feb-12.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA (MC.FR)

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: And the other striking development, that is something that we took up back in the 1980s. So you have to be  patient indeed. This takes us back 30 years. This was a business that was doing so-so but now has taken off  charge of this business, we are generating remarkable growth numbers. And so when the shops are sitting next to  a competitor that is supposed to be very successful, we will find it that Céline stores are generating more revenues,  of course in terms of per square meter, but also in absolute numbers that Céline is doing better than its biggest  competitors. And even though we have about 100 stores or so under that brand, it's doing extremely well. I am not  saying that there will be more Louis Vuitton in the future, but at least we are certainly expecting new businesses of  the same elk, and so we are extremely well positioned, even though of course we can't rule out the possibility of  there being ups and downs that is in the international economic climate. But of course it may sound paradoxical  seen from here in France or indeed from Europe, but this is a very promising outlook.

texts.speaker: Jean-Jacques Guiony
texts.profession: Head-Finance, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA
texts.text: Europe, lastly. Average growth of 7% across the year. Not that bad, given the current climate. 8% at the end of  September; 3% in Q4. And in fact what you need to realize is Q4 was affected by sales that took place in Q4 as the  previous year, 2010, in November, [indiscernible] (25:25) we sold ships that had been built for our own account,  and that had a heavy impact on quarterly growth in Europe. If we eliminate that growth effect, we are at 7%. So in  fact there is no slowdown in Q4 in Europe. We're on a 7% trend as for the rest of year because the average is about  7% or 8% if it's restated for that. In fact, restated for that at Group level, the 14% – rather, the 12% that I  mentioned earlier for Q4 would become almost 14%. So you see here, there hasn't been any manifest slowdown in  trend. Same thing. So that's the split of sales by division.

file: MC - Q4 2012 Earnings Call 31January2013 1200 PM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Jan-13.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA (MC.FR)

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: So, we are in a situation in 2012 where the group once again has posted exceptional performance. The market was  buoyant in 2012, slightly lesser in the second half than in the first half. And you will no doubt ask me how 2013 is  shaping up and what our sentiment at the group is regarding the business climate for 2013.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: I believe we can be confident for the overall business climate, because the world is growing. It may be surprising  to say that from France, where we see pessimistic articles about the situation in Europe, but it remains that France  and Europe are today in a difficult situation in terms of economic growth whereas the world is poised to post  about 4% growth this year.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.profession: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: For 2013, as I indicated earlier, the global growth climate is still present, save in Europe, but in Europe, we also  sell a lot to visitors. So, we're less impacted by the economic stagnation than other sectors of activity. So in 2012  [sic] (2013), we're confident regarding business development. The only shadow here is currency trends. Mr.  Guiony said no worries, all that's hedged, even if the dollar collapses, we won't even feel it. Nevertheless, I'm a  little wary, but don't think it will lead to excellent consequences, we'll see what happens. And if we're hedged,  we're maybe hedged for 12 months or 18 months but we can't be hedged forever. So we'll end up by feeling it. In  any event, we'll have to increase prices.

file: MC - Q4 2013 Earnings Call 30January2014 1200 PM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jan-14.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA  (MC.FR )

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA
texts.text: Will, might you say, generally growth is faster? I'm expecting that question. So why has growth been of only 8%,  which is pretty good, and the result slightly less? Three reasons. First reason, the global economic climate, and  this will come as a surprise to no one, a number of high growth countries have slowed a little on the one hand.  Furthermore, China has taken a number of measures that were implemented during the course of the year such  that the consumption of luxury or rather high-end products has been slowed slightly.

file: MC - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 3February2015 1200 PM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Feb-15.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: So in 2014, the group's net profit has reached a record also in terms of sales and distribution, and we can say that  2014 was a good vintage for the group LVMH. The global economic climate was characterized by a good growth  level throughout the world, but mixed effects. On the currency front, we were impacted adversely by the currency  trends, as you will see in a moment. There was a change during the year. And in the second half, the euro managed  to decline, which hadn't happened for a number of years and this made our products more competitive for French  exporters. In general, it was very buoyant, furthermore the economy at the end of the year was somewhat boosted  by two factors; the drop in the price of oil and more recently by the injection of liquidity into the European  economy.

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: And lastly, against the backdrop of the business climate that varies from country to country, a rigorous cost  containment, well, that's straightforward, will be continued, that's why we're confident for 2015. Over now to  Jean-Jacques Guiony to review the financials in greater detail.

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE
texts.text: Other brands are also growing well, have grown well in 2016. Strong increase in Fendi. Loro Piana, that's opened  a store at the end of – right close by. Unfortunately, it'll be closed at the end of this meeting, but I urge you to take  a look when you can. There are some very fine products there, especially with the cold weather. There's some  fine cashmere products available. Other brands making good progress; Céline, of course. Kenzo, that's been  repositioned. Berluti there again is achieving considerable success.

file: MC - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 25January2018 1200 PM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Jan-18.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE
texts.text: In champagne, the success is equally spectacular with moderate manufacturing constraints because the climate  this year wasn't great. So production constraints there again that we, of course, depend on.

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE
texts.text: Asset prices are reaching stratospheric levels, equities or physical assets, a period of total unreality. There hasn't  been a crisis for 10 years. I'm personally convinced that over the next five years – I can't say when, but there will  be a crisis, so we have to be cautious. That's why I say that for 2018, I'm confident, but one needs to be cautious.

file: MC - Q4 2018 Earnings Call 29January2019 1200 PM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Jan-19.pdf
company_name: LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE
texts.text: That being said, the long-term view which been the success of LVMH, the reason this group's been successful for  20 years, we've seen across-the-board increases in people's purchasing power and in our customer's living  standards. That's going to continue. For the medium-term, therefore, we can continue to be very optimistic. I am.  This is also why I continue investing in this group and I very much believe in its prospects. The environment, the  economy was buoyant in 2018.

texts.speaker: Bernard Arnault
texts.profession: Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton SE
texts.text: Before concluding, I'd like to say that all this is very positive, giving us every reason to be proud, all of our  employees and all of our managers can be proud. I'd like to emphasize briefly two points. Firstly, all of us pay  careful attention to the environment to sustainable development. I'd also like to mention parenthetically that this  has been a concern of ours for 25 years. We're the group that began environment activities probably the longest  ago of all the CAC 40 companies. We've a very active program. We try to make sure that a large proportion of our  products are designed with the environment in mind. We make sure that we adhere to the top standards  worldwide. I won't delve into detail, but we try to cut our greenhouse emissions. This year, we're doubling the  Carbon Fund that we set up. We also are constantly striving to improve the environmental performance of our  production sites and our stores, our programs carefully keep track of. I'd also say that it's received many  international awards and they're recognized by various organizations.

texts.speaker: Ennio Doris
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer
texts.text: Being customer centric for us means to leave the fears and the joys of our customers and to make them our own,  but in a tangible way. For example, coming to aide in year end to death and natural disaster destroys the customer  home or business, or their monthly mortgage payments become intolerable, and so on. In order words, it's no  longer enough to look after their short term interest. It's actually becoming expected that we also do something  that will better the world.
